title: API Health Dashboard
vision: A real-time Azure API Health Dashboard that provides a comprehensive view of API endpoint health across multiple services. Features four main sections: (1) A status grid showing each API endpoint as a card with current status (healthy/degraded/down), P95 response time, and 7-day uptime percentage; (2) A latency distribution chart plotting P50/P95/P99 response times over the past 24 hours with toggleable per-endpoint breakdown; (3) A failure log table showing the last 20 failed requests with timestamp, endpoint, HTTP status code, error message, and correlation ID; (4) A dependency map panel visualizing upstream/downstream service dependencies as a simple node graph with health indicators on each edge.
problem: Platform engineers and SREs lack a single-pane-of-glass view into API endpoint health, latency trends, failure patterns, and service dependency status — forcing them to jump between multiple monitoring tools to diagnose issues.
successCriteria: Status grid with per-endpoint cards showing healthy/degraded/down, P95 response time, and 7-day uptime percentage
Latency distribution SVG chart with P50/P95/P99 lines over 24 hours and toggleable per-endpoint breakdown
Failure log table with 20 rows: timestamp, endpoint, HTTP status, error message, correlation ID
Dependency map panel with node graph showing upstream/downstream service connections and health indicators on edges
constraints: Single page with collapsible sidebar navigation
Mock data only — no live API calls
Resource page layout with CuiAppFrame, header, side nav
